pullRequest.title: Add new remote params
pullRequest.bodyText:
Add unsubscribeWhenNotificationAreDisable remote param
Add disableGMSMissingPrompt remote param
Add locationShared remote param
Add requiresUserPrivacyConcent remote param
Keep public method
Add tests for new getters



This change is

commit.message:
Add task delay due to requiring consent from remote params

   * Move task management to TaskController
   * Delay task until remote params and init is done
   * After task delayed, check again for user consent
   * Fix test, add tests
Remove extra check/schedule on pending tasks

nodes.bodyText: We can remove the entire UI for this location shared interface now, not just the public method. I can deal with that later though. Lets add a TODO for now and explain that this public method was replaced with a remote param
Remove this privacy consent boolean as well now
Remove this location shared boolean as well now
Are we keeping this public method for a reason? Isnt this a remote param now or are we keeping both?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -30,7 +30,6 @@ public void onCreate() {
         OneSignal.unsubscribeWhenNotificationsAreDisabled(true);

nodes.bodyText: Should we use logger.verbose here?
Should we use logger.verbose here?
Should we use logger.debug here?
Should we use logger.verbose here?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -569,10 +531,8 @@ public static void setAppContext(@NonNull Context context) {
             OneSignal.onesignalLog(LOG_LEVEL.VERBOSE, "appContext set and an old appId was found, attempting to call setAppId(oldAppId)");

nodes.bodyText: Should we use logger.verbose here?
Should we use logger.verbose here?

Add a space after :? SO when we append it we can read a little easier
Example:
OneSignal is shareLocation enabled: true
instead
OneSignal is shareLocation enabled:true
Is there a reason we used Boolean class instead of primitive for locationShared and requiresUserPrivacyConsent?
Why did we change this app_id? Just curious
Should we construct a JSONObject and use toString method instead of hardcoding this?

ApplicationProvider.getApplicationContext() is okay to set context with also and it will be more consistent with our other UnitTests. However, I think we should call this inside of the UnitTests individually so its easier to understand that this is an important part of the new OneSignal init
Maybe we should still pass in a boolean param so it's easier it read? I saw this always sets it true
new line OneSignalInit(); this
Removed redundant if outside of synchronized

Integer.MAX_VALUE seems a bit aggressive maybe we should just do -1?
I don't think we have any negative subscription statuses, but maybe im wrong...
